## What is VS Code?

## Installation

### Step 1: Download VS Code

1. Go to [code.visualstudio.com](https://code.visualstudio.com/)
2. Click the big download button (it auto-detects your operating system)
3. Run the installer

### Step 2: Install Essential Extensions

Extensions add features to VS Code. Click the **Extensions** icon in the left sidebar (or press `Cmd+Shift+X` on Mac / `Ctrl+Shift+X` on Windows) and install these:

| Extension | Purpose |
|-----------|---------|
| **Python** | Python language support |
| **Quarto** | Quarto document support |
| **R** | R language support |
| **Jupyter** | Jupyter notebook support |
| **GitLens** | Enhanced Git features |

::: {.callout-note}
## Quick Install
You can also install extensions from the command line:
```bash
code --install-extension ms-python.python
code --install-extension quarto.quarto
code --install-extension rdebugger.r-debugger
```
:::

## Opening a Project

### Method 1: Open Folder
1. Go to **File â†’ Open Folder**
2. Select your project folder
3. Click **Open**

### Method 2: From Terminal
```bash
# Navigate to your project
cd path/to/your/project

# Open in VS Code
code .
```

### Method 3: Clone from GitHub
1. Press `Cmd+Shift+P` (Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+P` (Windows)
2. Type "Git: Clone"
3. Paste the repository URL
4. Choose where to save it

## Working with Python

### Setting Up Python

1. Install the **Python extension** (see above)
2. Open a `.py` file or create one
3. VS Code will ask you to select a Python interpreter
4. Choose your installed Python version

### Running Python Code

**Option 1: Run File**
- Click the â–¶ï¸ play button in the top-right
- Or right-click and select "Run Python File in Terminal"

**Option 2: Run Selection**
- Select code
- Press `Shift+Enter` to run just that selection

**Option 3: Interactive Window**
- Press `Shift+Enter` on any line to run in interactive mode
- Great for exploring data!

### Jupyter Notebooks in VS Code

1. Create a file with `.ipynb` extension
2. Or open an existing notebook
3. Click **+ Code** or **+ Markdown** to add cells
4. Press `Shift+Enter` to run a cell

---

## Working with R

### Setting Up R

1. Install R from [cran.r-project.org](https://cran.r-project.org/)
2. Install the **R extension** in VS Code
3. Install the `languageserver` package in R:
   ```r
   install.packages("languageserver")
   ```

### Running R Code

- Select code and press `Cmd+Enter` (Mac) or `Ctrl+Enter` (Windows)
- The R terminal will open automatically

---

## Working with Quarto

### Setting Up Quarto

1. Install Quarto from [quarto.org](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)
2. Install the **Quarto extension** in VS Code

### Creating Quarto Documents

1. Create a file with `.qmd` extension
2. Add YAML front matter:
   ```yaml
   ---
   title: "My Analysis"
   format: html
   ---
   ```
3. Write markdown and code chunks

### Previewing Quarto Documents

- Press `Cmd+Shift+K` (Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+K` (Windows)
- Or click **Preview** in the top-right
- Or run in terminal: `quarto preview document.qmd`

---

## The Integrated Terminal

The terminal is built right into VS Code!

### Opening the Terminal
- Press `` Ctrl+` `` (backtick)
- Or go to **View â†’ Terminal**

### Common Commands

```bash
# Navigate folders
cd folder-name       # Go into folder
cd ..                # Go up one level
ls                   # List files (Mac/Linux)
dir                  # List files (Windows)

# Git commands
git status           # See what's changed
git add .            # Stage all changes
git commit -m "msg"  # Commit with message
git push             # Push to GitHub

# Python
python script.py     # Run a Python script
pip install package  # Install a package

# Quarto
quarto preview       # Preview document
quarto render        # Render to output
```

## Settings & Customization

### Accessing Settings
- Press `Cmd+,` (Mac) or `Ctrl+,` (Windows)
- Or go to **Code â†’ Preferences â†’ Settings**

### Recommended Settings for Beginners

Search for these in settings:

| Setting | Recommended Value |
|---------|-------------------|
| Auto Save | `afterDelay` (saves automatically!) |
| Font Size | `14` or larger |
| Word Wrap | `on` |
| Format On Save | `on` |

### Themes
Want a different look? Press `Cmd+K Cmd+T` to browse themes!

## Which Should I Use?
For this course, we recommend **VS Code** as your primary editor because:
- It handles both R and Python equally well
- It has the best Git integration
- It's the most widely used in industry

## Troubleshooting

### "Python not found"
- Install Python from [python.org](https://www.python.org/)
- In VS Code, press `Cmd+Shift+P` â†’ "Python: Select Interpreter"

### "R not found"
- Install R from [cran.r-project.org](https://cran.r-project.org/)
- Restart VS Code

### "Quarto not found"
- Install Quarto from [quarto.org](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)
- Restart VS Code

### Extensions not working
1. Check the extension is enabled
2. Restart VS Code
3. Check the OUTPUT panel for errors
